data.expected: BT x BT -> 1/4 BB, 1/2 BT, 1/4 TT
data.sampled:
Blue x Blue -> 4/4 Blue - Parent phenotype 1 has a genotype B_B_ (homozygous dominant) while Parent phenotype 2 also has a genotype B_B_ (homozygous dominant). All of their offspring will have a genotype of B_B_ and thus a phenotype of Blue.
3/4 Blue 1/4 Green - Parent phenotype 1 has a genotype B_G_ while Parent phenotype 2 has a genotype B_T_. Their offspring will all have a genotype of B_Gt_ where t represents the Turquoise allele. This means that half of their offspring will have a phenotype of Blue and half will have a phenotype of Green.
3/4 Blue 1/4 Turquoise - Parent phenotype 1 has a genotype B_T_ while Parent phenotype 2 has a genotype B_Gt_. Their offspring will all have a genotype of B_Gt_ where t represents the Turquoise allele. This means that three quarters of their offspring will have a phenotype of Blue and one quarter will have a phenotype of Turquoise.
